summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 between attorneys at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP discussing a FOIA response. The response includes a 1994 New Mexico State Land Office document where Ghislaine Maxwell appraises land for Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Trust, swearing she is a 'disinterested' party. The chain forwards copies of the 1993-1994 land transaction records.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.role: Trustee of the Zorro Trust, purchaser of New Mexico land
persons.context: He is the trustee of the Zorro Trust, which is purchasing land in Santa Fe County, New Mexico in 1993, and is the lessee/applicant for improvements on the land in 1994.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is named on a 1994 New Mexico State Land Office document as the appraiser for Epstein's land, swearing under penalty of perjury that she is a 'disinterested' party in the transaction.

persons.name: John J. Kelly
persons.context: Appointed by Jeffrey Epstein via a Limited Power of Attorney in March 1993 to act on his behalf in closing the purchase of New Mexico land for the Zorro Trust.

persons.name: Henry I. Beuer
persons.context: Mentioned in a note at the end of the document as a name that appears on many corporate documents; appears to be a signature on a notary seal.

connections.description: Maxwell acted as the appraiser for Epstein's New Mexico land acquisition in 1994, formally certifying the land's value for the state lease application.
Epstein appointed Kelly as his attorney-in-fact via a Limited Power of Attorney to handle the closing of a New Mexico land purchase in 1993.

events.title: Execution of Limited Power of Attorney
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein, as trustee of the Zorro Trust, executes a Limited Power of Attorney appointing John J. Kelly to act on his behalf to close the purchase of New Mexico land.

events.title: Closing of New Mexico Land Purchase
events.description: The Zorro Trust closes on the purchase of real property and associated assets in Santa Fe County, New Mexico from King Brothers Ranch, King Land & Cattle Company, and Pine Canyon Ranch, Inc.

events.title: Land Improvement Application and Appraisal
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein applies to the New Mexico State Land Office for permission to make improvements on the leased land. Ghislaine Maxwell provides an appraisal for the land, swearing she is a disinterested party.

locations: Stanley, NM (mailing address for Zorro Ranch)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell appears on a 1994 New Mexico State Land Office document appraising land for Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Trust.
In the 1994 document, Maxwell swears under penalty of perjury that she is a 'disinterested person' in the transaction, a legal requirement for the appraiser.
The email chain highlights this as potentially the earliest document the attorneys have seen with Maxwell's name associated with Epstein.
The underlying records show Epstein's Zorro Trust was acquiring significant land (over 1,158 acres) in Santa Fe County, New Mexico in 1993-1994.
The documents include a 1993 Limited Power of Attorney where Epstein appoints John J. Kelly to handle the land purchase closing.
